title: DSP Software Engineer - Image Signal Processing, Computer Vision, Neural Network
description:
JOB TITLE

DSP Software Engineer – Image Signal Processing, Computer Vision, Neural Network
OVERVIEW & IMPACT
Samsung SoC Lab in San Diego is looking for DSP engineers to join the team of passionate engineers to build world-class multimedia solutions. The candidates are expected to bring passion, innovation and strong execution in Image Signal Processing, Computer Vision and Neural Network SW design and optimization.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and implement DSP SW for ISP (image signal processing), CV (computer vision) and NN (Neural Network) on VLIW SIMD vector processors, and cycle optimizations
Participate in the design, implementation, integration, and verification of fixed-point DSP SW, and contribute to the architectural design of current and next generation vector processors
Work with algorithm members to drive innovations in optimization for the best user experience of multimedia solutions

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Masters in Electrical or Computer Engineering + 3 years industry experience or PhD
Strong hands-on assembly coding on VLIW SIMD vector processors
Strong experience in C/C++ programming
Ability to work in a team environment with multiple teams and challenging schedules

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Background in ISP, CV and NN is a big plus
Linux scripting and Matlab programming is a plus

Samsung Semiconductor Inc. (SSI), an equal opportunity employer, is a world leader in Memory, System LSI, and LCD technologies. Headquartered in San Jose, California, SSI is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd., the second largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world and the industry's volume and technology leader in DRAM, NAND Flash, SSDs, mobile DRAM and graphics memory. It is one of the largest providers of system logic, imaging and LED lighting solutions, as well as providing advanced process design and manufacturing for fabless companies. Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. also has a research and innovation center with numerous labs providing product design and research in: logic, memory, image sensors, displays and mobile technologies. In addition, the company supports Samsung Display Company, the largest producer of LCD and OLED displays.

*************************************************************************************************

Learn more about Samsung Semiconductor here.

A day in the life Samsung Video

Samsung Semiconductor Career Page

title: Vision Signal Processing Lead Engineer
description:
Mitsubishi Electric Automotive America creates high-quality in-car systems for major OEMs around the world. Known for our innovative components, we leverage our deep technology expertise to deliver autonomous-ready infotainment and ADAS solutions, premium audio systems, high-definition displays, and powertrain electronics for standard, EV, and hybrid vehicles. This professional will lead vision system signal processing and algorithm development activities. This involves working directly with our customers as well as communicating directly with our engineering team in Japan.

Algorithm Engineering
Lead vision based algorithm and detection development projects
Utilize a comprehensive understanding of current and research future trends in vision processing hardware and software (Open CV, Python, C++, MATLAB)
Uttilize their understanding of hardware design
Provide expert level understanding of Vision Processing Systems Software Architecture including comparative knowledge of a variety of Vision processing SOC vendors
Utilize understanding of the physical/mathmatical nature of Vision Signal Processing from Camera, to Signal construction, to image rectification and output including 3 dimension video playback and image stitching
Feature Management
Utilize their ability to plan and execute the development of software algorithms and features from POC through to Production development
Document and track issues, maintain the list through the life of the project(s)
Communicate information to assist algorithm development team in Japan
Requirements Management and Validation
Maintain and understand requirements documents.
Will “fill in the holes” in explaining requirements to our design team
Creatively suggest additional features and requirements that a customer may want
Sales Support
Support sales team in determining future technology strategies.
Support teleconference meetings with our design team in Japan (can be outside of normal working hours)
May do some limited travel to Japan for meetings with our design team.
May do some limited travel to customers’ sites for engineering meetings and presentations.
Support and assist the Senior Engineering Manager as needed.
Support and make recommendations to improve Company policies and procedures.
Further the goals and positive, professional image of the department by analyzing current processes, procedures and systems and makes recommendations for improvement for own job.

MSEE, MSCS, MSME, or PhD highly desired.
2 years minimum experience in vision or vision processing research and development.
2 years direct application development experience.
Understanding of Cyber Security threats and solutions.
Strong written, verbal, and cross-cultural communication skills.
Computer savvy, especially in Microsoft Office programs, database development, Web development.
Experience with industry tools for HILS, SILS, Matlab, Vector Tools, etc.
Software C, embedded C, C++, Open CV, Python, Caffee.

1st

title: Computer Vision Research Engineer
description:
STR is a privately-owned, rapidly growing business focused on research and development (R&D) for the defense and intelligence communities. STR has approximately 200 employees at sites in Woburn, MA, Dayton, OH and Arlington, VA. We are a nationally recognized leader in research areas including data analytics, sensors and signal processing, electronic warfare, cyber, video and image understanding, command and control, and precision navigation. Several programs have transitioned advanced technology to military and intelligence users. While our primary focus is on serving US Government customers, we are pursuing commercial applications as well.

Job Description:
Design and implement innovative computer vision algorithms for solving challenging scene understanding problems
Collaborate with other STR engineers and leading researchers in the computer vision community to develop, adapt, extend and optimize state-of-the-art techniques for addressing new sensor exploitation applications
Imagery of interest: visible/infrared still and video imagery from ground and aerial sensors; imaging radar; LIDAR
Application areas: object detection, tracking, classification; image registration; 3D modeling; performance modeling; contextual reasoning
Perform data analysis on experimental data and identify performance improvement strategies
Interact with national security customers and users to determine and assess appropriate solutions
Transition algorithms to real-time systems and/or prototype demonstrations
Position may involve travel to customer meetings and/or data collections and experiments
Qualifications:
PhD or MS degree with relevant experience in computer science, electrical engineering, applied mathematics or related technical discipline
Strong scientific software development skills
Independent analytical problem-solving skills
US citizenship is required; must have ability to obtain a security clearance
STR seeks to provide an outstanding work environment for its employees with excellent benefits and competitive compensation. Full-time employees enjoy 401(k), profit sharing, health and welfare benefits, subsidies for training and conference attendance to foster continued learning and development, and a casual yet technically challenging work environment.

STR is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce where all employees, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, neurodiversity, or other personal characteristics, feel valued, included, and empowered to achieve their best. We recognize that each employee’s backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are essential for providing our customers with innovative solutions to challenging national security problems. STR’s commitment to attracting, retaining, and engaging talented and diverse professionals is demonstrated by our participation, sponsorship, and support in local and national minority organizations.

Applicants must be US Citizens.

title: Computer Vision Engineer
description:
XMotors.ai provides autonomous self-driving features for the Xiaopeng EV vehicles in China market. We are looking for people passionate about self-driving vehicles to join in and help us build top class autonomous self-driving vehicles.
We are looking for motivated software engineer for developing our key autonomous driving algorithms on mass production cars. You will be working with a team of computer vision and AI engineers to develop, implement and validate CV algorithms on in-vehicle embedded systems.

Job Responsibilities:
Design and implement vision algorithms for our autonomous driving system
Test, debug and optimization to generate robust and efficient vision algorithms
Work with multi-discipline engineering team on HW/SW integration


Job Requirements:
MS/PhD in Computer Science/ Electrical Engineering or related disciplines and minimum 1~3 years of software engineering experiences
Deep knowledge in computer vision, 3D geometry and/or image processing
Excellent programming skills and knowledge of C/C++
Familiar with Computer Vision libraries like OpenCV, Ceres etc
Experience with implementing computer vision and image processing algorithms
Ability to analyze and optimize the algorithms to meet real time requirement
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Preferred:
Experience with autonomous driving
Experience with real time algorithms and RTOS


What do we provide:
A fun, supportive and engaging environment
Opportunities to pursue and work on cutting edge technologies
Competitive salary
Snacks, lunches and fun activities
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status or marital status or any other prescribed category set forth in federal or state regulations.

title: computer vision software engineer
description:
Light is pioneering the era of the software-defined camera. Powered by sophisticated computational processes, software-defined cameras deliver intelligent, high-quality imaging at cost-effective, global scale. Light’s first product, the award-winning L16 Camera, has eliminated the quality or convenience dilemma that has plagued photographers for a century. Light’s foundational technologies, including its Lux Capacitor camera control chip and its Polar Fusion Engine for multi-image processing, are licensed for use in applications like smartphones and beyond. To learn more about Light, visit light.co.
what you will do...
Develop and write production quality code for multi-view cameras - topics include calibration, registration, 3D geometry and image fusion
what you bring to Light
3-5 years of full time work experience in industry (not academic) where your primary role was working on computer vision problems
BS/MS in Computer Science or a related field
Solid knowledge of computer vision fundamentals
Strong programming techniques and demonstrated solid mathematical foundation
Experience developing in Linux environment
Strong knowledge of C++ a must and experience with C++11 features expected
Experience with 3D depth estimation and camera calibration experience a plus
Experience developing software for geometric calibration of cameras.
Good communication skills and experience collaborating with cross-functional teams
oh, but there's more...
You get your very own L16!
You get to up-level your game as you work with world class technologists who have proven they know how to create extraordinary technology.
We offer medical, dental, vision, life, family leave and commuter benefits.
We value flexibility and know that it's a 2-way street. So our teammates get to enjoy our open time off policy.
Our passion for photography is evident in everything we do from our in-house photo talks, gallery walks and other photography-obsessed events!
Food. Yes. We eat a lot.
Have we piqued your interest? Send us your resume and a note about what you bring to Light!

To reimagine photography, visit: https://light.co/.

Individuals seeking employment at Light are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

title: Senior Applied Research Engineer - Computer Vision & Machine Learning
description:
Job Description
Sony Corporation of America, located in New York, NY, is the U.S. headquarters of Sony Corporation, based in Tokyo, Japan. Sony's principal U.S. businesses include Sony Electronics Inc., Sony Mobile Communications (USA) Inc., Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC., Sony Pictures Entertainment Inc., Sony Music Entertainment, and Sony/ATV Music Publishing LLC. With some 900 million Sony devices in hands and homes worldwide today, a vast array of Sony movies, television shows and music, and the PlayStation Network, Sony creates and delivers more entertainment experiences to more people than anyone else on earth.

Sony US Research Center, San Jose, CA is seeking to welcome the best and the brightest into our world-class R&D team, and if you’re up to the challenge, we’d love to see what you’ve got. We’re inventing right here the technology and products that go on to touch customer’s lives all over the world, and soon we could be working to bring your ideas to life.

Responsibilities
Investigate and utilize complex engineering and mathematical principles to develop core technologies.
Contribute to research projects that develop a variety of algorithms and systems in bioinformatics, computer vision, image and video analysis.
Assess and improve algorithm performance on a variety of platforms.
Analyze and determine system standards and test procedures.
Evaluate identifiable factors and demonstrate good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.
Advance the state-of-the-art in the field, including generating patents.
Prototype and implement image and video analysis product components.
Work with researchers in global locations to understand algorithm requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.
Qualifications
Ph.D. Degree in Life Science areas, Biomedical/Electrical/Computer Engineering, or Computer Science.
Strong knowledge in system biology, proteomics, genomics, or single cell analysis.
Working knowledge of fundamentals in computer vision and image/video analysis, including Deep Learning.
Must be self-motivated and creative, with proven analytical skills, excellent research record, and ability to communicate effectively.
Flexibility and adaptability to work and collaborate with researchers in global locations.
Must be able to travel domestically and internationally if required.
Must be authorized to work in the USA.
Preferred experience:
Strong theoretical and practical background in Computer Vision, Image and Video analysis, specifically Object Detection, Tracking, Segmentation, Optical Flow, Optimization, Generative Models, Biological Imaging are strong plus
Proven ability to develop new research ideas as demonstrated by a strong publication record and early developments to the level of a working system prototype is a strong plus
Excellent programming skills in Python/Matlab and C/C++ is a strong plus
Solid knowledge on Deep Learning frameworks such as Caffe, Torch/PyTorch, TensorFlow, MXNet, or NNabla is a strong plus
Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, status in the U.S. uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information or membership in any other legally protected category.

title: Computer Vision Engineer
description:
Join the computer vision development team to deliver state-of the art algorithms in MATLAB and Simulink.
Develop state-of-the-art computer vision algorithms, apps and examples to deliver to customers worldwide
Participate in planning and prioritizing, write functional specifications and lead design reviews
Implement and test algorithms using MATLAB and C++ on Windows, Linux, and Macintosh platforms
Collaborate with other developers, quality engineers, usability specialists, and documentation writers
Ph.D. or M.S. and 4+ years of experience in solving computer vision problems
Broad foundation in computer vision theory and algorithms
Experience with MATLAB and C++
Software development experience
Excellent communications and team skills
Experience in the area of 3-D vision: camera calibration, multi-view geometry, SLAM, point cloud processing are highly desired
Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning
A bachelor's degree and 7 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 5 years of professional work experience, or a PhD degree) is required.

title: Senior Computer Vision Engineer
company: Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America, Inc.
description:
Embedded in a worldwide network Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America, Inc. continuously strives to remain at the forefront of successful automotive research and development. MBRDNA is headquartered in Silicon Valley, California, with key areas of Autonomous Driving, Advanced Interaction Design, Digital User Experience, Machine Learning, Costumer Research, and Business Innovation. In Redford, Michigan, the focus is on Powertrain and eDrive technology as well as in Long Beach, where the E-Mobility Group helps to shape the future of the North American market for hydrogen fuel cell and battery electric vehicles. The Testing and Regulatory Affairs Division in Ann Arbor and the Advanced Vehicle Design in Carlsbad complete the competence center.

Together, all the developers, technicians, engineers and designers take on the challenges of creating the next innovation. They’re inspired by the newest trends, find the best solutions for the customer, develop the latest and greatest technologies and create the next generation of connected, safe, sustainable and luxurious vehicles.

Here at MBRDNA, we are looking for talented, energetic, and committed individuals to join our diverse team. Our employees are the key to our success, and we support each individual in fulfilling his or her potential. We proudly continue the pioneering work initiated by founders Gottlieb Daimler and Carl Benz over 125 years ago.

Role Overview:

You will be helping to build the computer vision framework that drives our COROS (Cargo Object Recognition organization System) in a Mercedes-Benz van, specifically architect the parcel tracking system through data fusion from various 2D/3D sensors, use machine vision techniques and program accelerators, such as OpenMP, OpenCL/GPUs and VPUs to implement COROS.
You’ll design machine vision algorithms and implement them through prototyping and push the code into production system. You are not only implementing new models on top of existing framework to solve 3D machine vision problems in real world, but also you are helping to improve the core framework that unifies all the problems we are solving. The differentiation of our frameworks and models are that they are computationally and numerically much more efficient (orders of magnitude) than state of the art techniques.
You should have expertise in computer vision (or related field such as geometric algebra, computer graphics, machine learning/DCNNs, computational math, etc.), have worked on developing large scale, cost effective, deployable software projects, and have strong C /Python and mathematics background.

Key Tasks & Responsibilities:
Familiar with project management tools such as Microsoft Project, software engineering theory and tools (e.g. UML2 (Enterprise Architect), and knowledge management products (Confluence, and Jira), etc.
Expertise in OpenCV, PCL/OpenNI, Boost, Eigen, Linear Algebra, Ceres-Solver libraries
Experience developing large scale deployable complex code bases products, familiarity with version control tools such as GIT(GitHub/GitLab)
Minimum Skills Required:
Experience with ground truth metrics acquisition to cross-validate, analyze, and evaluate various 2D/3D data acquisition devices, such as Stereo (RealSense), Time of Flight (Kinect 2), and Structural Light (Orbbec) cameras or LiDaRs (e.g. Faro FocusX series) and their corresponding software packages
Expertise in Computer Vision, such as feature/color spaces, algorithms, filters, 3D Geometric Algebra/Matrice, non-linear optimization, and etc.
Expertise in Machine Learning, e.g. DCNNs, R-CNNs, RNNs, decision trees, statistics/probability theory for various object detection methodologies and related frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Caffe)
Strong C /Python, Multi-thread/CPU, OpenCL, and shell programming experience
Have experience leading a small group of Highly talented computer vision engineers.
BS in Computer Science/Engineering or related software-based fields.
Preferred Qualifications:
MS or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, CS/EE or Mathematics preferred
MBRDNA is an equal opportunity employer that offers generous benefits and compensation, work/life balance tools and several methods of recognition and rewards. Our benefits include medical, dental and vision insurance, 401K savings plan, tuition and fitness reimbursement programs and much more.

title: Camera Software - Imaging and Computer Vision Research Engineer
description:
Role Number:
200020297
The Computational Imaging team provides the innovative algorithms and image processing solutions for all of Apple’s awe-inspiring devices including iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch. Combining ground breaking machine learning and computer vision techniques with next-generation hardware, our team takes the mobile photography experience to the next level. If you are passionate about finding and solving new problems in computer vision and image processing, we have the job for you.
Key Qualifications
Proven research and practical experience in developing computer vision, machine
learning and imaging algorithms for image processing, photography, and video quality
A deep understanding of machine learning and computer vision concepts
Possess shown experience identifying new industry problems and providing viable solutions to those problems
You should be proficient written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work in multi-functional teams
Ability to manage numerous projects and prioritize work accordingly
You should have strong coding skills in: C/C++
Experience with iOS or other mobile systems as a plus
Description
The Computational Imaging team is seeking extraordinary, driven, and innovative developers to work on special computer vision, machine learning and image processing solutions. Through crafting advanced imaging algorithms and forward-looking features on our team, you will contribute to existing and future iterations of Apple's products. You will collaborate daily with our team of engineers to build a new and dynamic vision of how we approach new problems. You will contribute directly to solving those problems using creative and unique algorithms.
Education & Experience
MS/PhD in Image Processing, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Computer Science, or a related field is required

Familiarity with common development and debugging tools for embedded/mobile applications.
Familiarity with camera systems and ISP processing pipeline.

title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer, Entity Understanding
description:
Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We are disrupting an industry by changing how people search for jobs and how companies recruit top talent.

Glassdoor is leading the industry in how jobs seekers are matched to a job and we are building state of the art algorithms to power personalized jobs search experience for 60+ Million unique users per month and growing.

You will lead a highly talented team of engineers and data scientists using the latest open source technologies and frameworks to build entity recognition and query understanding features to optimize our personalized Jobs search experience.

Join us if you have a deep understanding of NLP and machine learning techniques and experience implementing those models at large scale in real-world applications.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead a team of engineers and data scientists to improve the quality of entity recognition and query understanding
Lead projects to define, research and implement entity extraction from our multi-lingual job description data-set, and improve query understanding features to optimize the search experience
Coordinate cross-team projects and proactively drive projects to completion
Key Qualifications:
Hands-on technical leader with excellent problem solving and analytical skills. Capable of making sound decisions and bringing others on board with proposed solutions.
Deep understanding and hands-on experience in applying machine learning solutions to solve real-world NLP problems
Hands-on experience using structured and unstructured data
Hands-on experience with supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms for regression, classification, and clustering
Experience with analyzing large data sets, using Hadoop, Spark or related technologies is a plus

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
M.S. or above in Computer Science or a related field

title: Computer Vision Engineer, 3D Vision
description:
Role Number:
200029192
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish! The 3D Vision team at Apple Maps is looking for world class talent to join our team of computer vision and machine learning experts. As part of this team you would be working with different data modalities collected by various moving platforms, aerial/satellite/ground. You need to have a strong interest in solving real problems where developing and implementing algorithms are important parts. You would join a team of fast moving and pragmatic problem solvers that are tackling problems on extremely large scale.
Key Qualifications
Solid C/C++ and system building skills
Solid fundamentals in Computer Vision
Experience with modern machine learning technologies
Description
The ideal candidate should be an excellent programmer and also excel in one or more of the following areas:
Visual Object Detection and Recognition
Optical character recognition in unconstrained environments
Multiple view geometry
Tracking
3D computer vision
Machine learning
Education & Experience
PhD/MSc. in Computer Vision or similar, alternatively a comparable industry career, with significant experience in state-of-the-art Computer Vision, Machine Learning and Pattern Recognition fields.
Additional Requirements

title: Computer Vision Engineer
description:
Overview

Analyzes, develops, designs, programs, debugs and implements Computer Vision software for use on enterprise mobile devices and systems. Develops testing and troubleshooting strategies, devices, and systems for computer vision software.

Responsibilities

This computer vision engineer will work with the EVM Data Capture team to design computer vision algorithms for mobile device applications using camera, machine learning, on device processing and cloud processing. Responsibilities for this position include:- Development & prototype computer vision algorithms, machine learning models and system to solve use case specific problems.- Integration of algorithms into native code and optimized for mobile platforms (i.e. Android)- Development and Integration of algorithms optimized to run on Android mobile device- Verification of third party algorithms- Analysis of third party algorithms and competitive solutions- Design, develop and deploy solutions using computer vision and machine learning- Productizing of software solutions utilizing machine learning frameworks

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Bachelors & Masters degree from an accredited university in Computer Science, Mathematics, Imaging Science, or related.Experience with algorithm / ML modeling design

Industry experience developing computer vision technology

title: Senior Algorithm Engineer - Computer Vision!
description:
Senior Algorithm Engineer - Computer Vision!
If you are a Senior Algorithms Engineer with skills in Image Processing, Computer Vision, ML, please read on!
Top Reasons to Work with Us
Based just about 20 miles NW of downtown Boston, MA. We are a product and people driven company working red hot technology in imaging systems and detection services to make the world a better place. We are leading the technology with our hot products and receiving a lot of attention for it. We are looking for a highly talented Senior Algorithm Engineer to join now!

If you are proficient at design and development of image processing algorithms, machine learning and computer vision as a specialist and preferably with 3D imaging/3D CT data work, and an engineer with a degree (MS or preferably PhD) in EE, Computer Engineering or CS, then we would like to tell you more about our great opportunity.

Base salary DOE $120 -160K and DOE

What You Will Be Doing

Responsible for implementing your algorithms into production code.

We have been operating for 6 + years, very well funded, and product out to market! We are selling product and have exceptional leadership.

You will actively participate and can lead in product development plans, with emphasis on image processing and analysis, object detection, and imaging software engineering. Your work will be a push in prototyping and Research and Develop for optimal algorithms for automated threat recognition (ATR) within 3-D Computed Tomography images!

with solid software programming in Python, C++, CUDA

title: Data Scientist - Computer Vision
description:
Data Scientist
Verb Surgical - A Google and Johnson & Johnson joint venture!

Your mission is to find innovative ways to extract insights from clinical procedures which are important to clinicians, hospitals and patients. Build models which can describe scenes, actions and decisions critical to the surgical procedure. You will extract information from a large variety of data sources, including video, imaging data, robot sensors and clinical data. Your work will require interacting and understanding clinical needs and the latest research in machine learning. You will be experimenting with large clinical data sets collected in clinical environments and finding ways to provide value to various stakeholders through analysis. You will have a passion for leveraging data analytics to improve healthcare.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop models to extract information insights from data sets
Interact with clinicians and other stakeholders to understand analytic needs
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources, data gathering and annotation techniques.
Collaborate with stakeholders across the company to integrate models into product
Manage collaborations with external research partners
Contribute to and interact with research community
Requirements:

3+ years of experience developing analytics models
Experience working with a variety of data sources such as images, sensors and clinical data
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, deep learning, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Working with cross-functional teams in fast paced environment: collecting requirements/inputs and reporting results
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
Background in computer vision desired
Masters or PhD in electrical engineering, computer science, biomedical engineering or other related field
Who is Verb Surgical?

Verb Surgical is shaping the future of surgery. A new future, a future unimagined even a few years ago, which will involve machine learning, robotic surgery, instrumentation, advanced visualization, and data analytics. A future of surgery that aims to achieve improved patient outcomes, lower costs, and greater hospital efficiency.

Verb Surgical was founded with technology, expertise, and funding from Verily (formerly Google Life Sciences) and Ethicon, a medical device company in the Johnson & Johnson family of companies. This company will continue in strong partnership with Verily and Johnson & Johnson (Google and Johnson & Johnson Team for Robotic Surgery) to advance the surgical tools and capabilities available to surgeons and OR professionals today.

title: Staff Software Engineer (Computer Vision)
description:
The Climate Corporation is revolutionizing the agriculture industry with a platform and products that are helping the world’s farmers sustainably increase productivity with digital tools. As the industry leader, we’re working to ensure we’re the most connected platform in Agriculture. Through our partnerships, farmers can exchange data between the Climate FieldView™ platform and our partner connected solutions in just minutes.

We have an opportunity for a Staff Engineer position in our Geospatial Engineering Group to work with a team of specialized and highly experienced computer vision and remote sensing software engineers to help us enhance and expand our satellite and drone imagery processing systems. We ingest, archive and process vast amounts of multi-spectral space-borne and air-borne imagery and vector data that provide the maps and information that help our customers manage farming activities on their fields at a global scale. As a Staff Engineer in our team you will be tasked with the design and implementation of data-intensive high-performance satellite image processing systems and the operationalization of computer vision algorithms (including documentation, systems and algorithms analysis, design, refactoring, characterization, scaling out and up, parallelization, dependencies vetting, etc.) to expand our back-end capabilities. Your contributions will help the team deliver high-quality near-real-time actionable maps and value-added imagery analytics data to the company stakeholders and to our customers and help them make data-driven decisions. If you are passionate about innovation and excited about being a key contributor to building a sustainable business, we would love to talk to you!

What You Will Do:
Analyze system and product requirements to design optimal architectural designs.
Iteratively develop and implement evolvable designs for scalable sub-systems
Participate and support the verification and validation of operationalized algorithms.
Document operationalization designs, changes and configuration control processes.
Lead technical reviews and perform technical risks management and mitigation.
Coach and mentor junior members on the team in data-intensive systems design.
Drive collaboration and coordination of across-teams work.
Improve our software engineering processes towards the continuous improvement of reliability, scalability, and maintainability of all our systems.
Basic Qualifications:
Demonstrable experience (8+ years) building highly-reliable production software systems that process and manipulate large volumes of imagery data.
Solid understanding of computer science and computer vision fundamentals.
Solid understanding of functional programming, object-oriented design, data structures, design, verification, and validation techniques, and complexity analysis.
Additional Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in operationalizing computer vision algorithms for critical business systems.
Experience working with AWS-based systems in production.
Experience using Scrum best practices in software development projects.
Experience writing reliable and maintainable code in Scala, Python, and/or Java.
Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, engineering diagrams.
Possessing a systems-thinking mentality able to go from detailed to general and back.
Excellent leadership skills with high integrity, work ethics, humility, and self-awareness.
Excellent listening skills with a high degree of empathy for others.
Excellent ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to handle multiple, competing priorities in a fast-paced development environment.
Ability to navigate ambiguity and deliver value incrementally in the right direction.
Passion for computer vision, satellite data processing, geospatial engineering, and maps.
Master’s/ Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related engineering fields.
What We Offer:
Our teams are composed of industry experts, top scientists, and talented engineers. The environment is extremely engaging and fast-paced, with dozens of specialties coming together to provide the best possible products and experiences for our customers.

We provide competitive salaries and some of the best perks in the industry, including:
Superb medical, dental, vision, life, disability benefits, and a 401k matching program
A stocked kitchen with a large assortment of snacks & drinks to get you through the day
Encouragement to get out of the office and into the field with agents and farmers to see first-hand how our products are being used
We take part and offer various workshops, conferences, meet-up groups, tech-talks, and hackathons to encourage participation and growth in both community involvement and career development
We also hinge our cultural DNA on these five values:
Inspire one another
Innovate in all we do
Leave a mark on the world
Find the possible in the impossible
Be direct and transparent
Learn more about our team and our mission:
The Climate Corporation - The Technology Behind Making A Difference
https://youtu.be/c5TgbpE9UBI or visit https://climate.com/careers

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, The Climate Corporation is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@climate.com

title: Research Scientist or Postdoctoral Associate-Computer Vision, MouseLight
description:
About HHMI

Howard Hughes Medical Institute (HHMI) is a science philanthropy whose mission is to advance biomedical research and science education for the benefit of humanity. We empower exceptional scientists and students to pursue fundamental questions about living systems, and work to share scientific discoveries with researchers, students, and science-curious individuals around the world.

Founded in 1953 by aviator and industrialist Howard R. Hughes, HHMI is headquartered in Chevy Chase, Maryland, and employs more than 2,500 people across the U.S. Visit hhmi.org/careers to learn more about working at HHMI.

About Janelia

Janelia Research Campus is a pioneering research center in Ashburn, Virginia, where scientists pursue fundamental questions in neuroscience and imaging. The Howard Hughes Medical Institute (HHMI) launched Janelia in 2006, establishing an intellectually distinctive environment for scientists to do creative, collaborative, hands-on work. To learn more about working at Janelia, visit janelia.org/careers.

Summary

The Howard Hughes Medical Institute's Janelia Research Campus is looking for an outstanding Research Scientist or Postdoctoral Associate interested in applying innovative computational tools to whole-brain imaging datasets imaged with unprecedented resolution and scale. The MouseLight project team is an ongoing collaborative effort involving several experimental research groups at Janelia. The team generates reconstructions of neuronal morphology, tracking individual axonal projections across the entire mouse brain. We seek a candidate interested in automation of neurite identification and reconstruction. Due to the success of the proof-of-concept phase, this project has received additional resources to meet the goals of increased throughput in axonal reconstruction on an aggressive timeline. Individuals interested in developing and/or applying novel image segmentation, machine learning, and optimization algorithms are encouraged to apply. The Janelia Research Campus is a unique, world-class research institute with a major focus on the development of cutting-edge imaging and analysis tools. Candidates interested in this position would be encouraged to work closely with image-processing and machine-learning experts working on related problems at Janelia (e.g., Group Leaders Kristin Branson, Stephan Saalfeld, and Srini Turaga). Individuals interested in pursuing an academic research career or a specialist with experience as a software developer/engineer are encouraged to apply.

Principal Responsibilities:
Leverage computer vision, pattern recognition and machine learning expertise to innovate and implement state-of-the-art algorithms for detection, segmentation, inference and 3D reconstruction from large scale images.
Efficiently utilize existing software tools and architectures to meet project goals.
Work collaboratively with a team of scientists, software engineers, and annotators/proofreaders to implement an effective strategy for next generation high-throughput neuronal morphology identification and reconstruction pipeline.

Preferred Qualifications:
PhD in Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, Engineering, Neuroscience or a related discipline.
Strong background in image segmentation, and/or image analysis.
Strong understanding of machine vision and machine learning concepts.
Familiarity with high-performance computing and efficient handling of large datasets on modern multi-core or GPU platforms.
Established collaborative programming skills in Java, C/C++, Python or similar languages.
Ability to work and support interdisciplinary work in small groups.
Ability to develop novel approaches.

Additional Information:

To apply, please upload your CV, cover letter, and include the names and contact information of three references.

HHMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Computer Vision Software Engineer
description:
Computer Vision Software Engineer
If you are a Computer Vision Software Engineer with computer vision experience, please read on!

Half an hour from the Gulf in beautiful Lafayette, LA, we are an innovative, revolutionary, and global automation systems company that specializes in unmanned marine vessels. We have over 100 autonomous vessels running for thousands of hours that are revolutionizing how water-crafts are used. We are taking away danger, and reducing costs in a wide range of activities on the sea. If you are interested in joining an impactful company that pushes the envelope in maritime robotics and definitely cares about providing a great working environment for its employees, then apply immediately.
What You Will Be Doing

title: Senior Computer Vision Engineer
company: Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America, Inc.
description:
Embedded in a worldwide network Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America, Inc. continuously strives to remain at the forefront of successful automotive research and development. MBRDNA is headquartered in Silicon Valley, California, with key areas of Autonomous Driving, Advanced Interaction Design, Digital User Experience, Machine Learning, Costumer Research, and Business Innovation. In Redford, Michigan, the focus is on Powertrain and eDrive technology as well as in Long Beach, where the E-Mobility Group helps to shape the future of the North American market for hydrogen fuel cell and battery electric vehicles. The Testing and Regulatory Affairs Division in Ann Arbor and the Advanced Vehicle Design in Carlsbad complete the competence center.

Together, all the developers, technicians, engineers and designers take on the challenges of creating the next innovation. They’re inspired by the newest trends, find the best solutions for the customer, develop the latest and greatest technologies and create the next generation of connected, safe, sustainable and luxurious vehicles.

Here at MBRDNA, we are looking for talented, energetic, and committed individuals to join our diverse team. Our employees are the key to our success, and we support each individual in fulfilling his or her potential. We proudly continue the pioneering work initiated by founders Gottlieb Daimler and Carl Benz over 125 years ago.

Role Overview:

You will be helping to build the computer vision framework that drives our COROS (Cargo Object Recognition organization System) in a Mercedes-Benz van, specifically architect the parcel tracking system through data fusion from various 2D/3D sensors, use machine vision techniques and program accelerators, such as OpenMP, OpenCL/GPUs and VPUs to implement COROS.
You’ll design machine vision algorithms and implement them through prototyping and push the code into production system. You are not only implementing new models on top of existing framework to solve 3D machine vision problems in real world, but also you are helping to improve the core framework that unifies all the problems we are solving. The differentiation of our frameworks and models are that they are computationally and numerically much more efficient (orders of magnitude) than state of the art techniques.
You should have expertise in computer vision (or related field such as geometric algebra, computer graphics, machine learning/DCNNs, computational math, etc.), have worked on developing large scale, cost effective, deployable software projects, and have strong C /Python and mathematics background.

Key Tasks & Responsibilities:
Familiar with project management tools such as Microsoft Project, software engineering theory and tools (e.g. UML2 (Enterprise Architect), and knowledge management products (Confluence, and Jira), etc.
Expertise in OpenCV, PCL/OpenNI, Boost, Eigen, Linear Algebra, Ceres-Solver libraries
Experience developing large scale deployable complex code bases products, familiarity with version control tools such as GIT(GitHub/GitLab)
Minimum Skills Required:
Experience with ground truth metrics acquisition to cross-validate, analyze, and evaluate various 2D/3D data acquisition devices, such as Stereo (RealSense), Time of Flight (Kinect 2), and Structural Light (Orbbec) cameras or LiDaRs (e.g. Faro FocusX series) and their corresponding software packages
Expertise in Computer Vision, such as feature/color spaces, algorithms, filters, 3D Geometric Algebra/Matrice, non-linear optimization, and etc.
Expertise in Machine Learning, e.g. DCNNs, R-CNNs, RNNs, decision trees, statistics/probability theory for various object detection methodologies and related frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Caffe)
Strong C /Python, Multi-thread/CPU, OpenCL, and shell programming experience
Have experience leading a small group of Highly talented computer vision engineers.
BS in Computer Science/Engineering or related software-based fields.
Preferred Qualifications:
MS or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, CS/EE or Mathematics preferred
MBRDNA is an equal opportunity employer that offers generous benefits and compensation, work/life balance tools and several methods of recognition and rewards. Our benefits include medical, dental and vision insurance, 401K savings plan, tuition and fitness reimbursement programs and much more.

description:

title: DSP Software Engineer - Image Signal Processing, Computer Vision, Neural Network
description:
JOB TITLE

DSP Software Engineer – Image Signal Processing, Computer Vision, Neural Network
OVERVIEW & IMPACT
Samsung SoC Lab in San Diego is looking for DSP engineers to join the team of passionate engineers to build world-class multimedia solutions. The candidates are expected to bring passion, innovation and strong execution in Image Signal Processing, Computer Vision and Neural Network SW design and optimization.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and implement DSP SW for ISP (image signal processing), CV (computer vision) and NN (Neural Network) on VLIW SIMD vector processors, and cycle optimizations
Participate in the design, implementation, integration, and verification of fixed-point DSP SW, and contribute to the architectural design of current and next generation vector processors
Work with algorithm members to drive innovations in optimization for the best user experience of multimedia solutions

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Masters in Electrical or Computer Engineering + 3 years industry experience or PhD
Strong hands-on assembly coding on VLIW SIMD vector processors
Strong experience in C/C++ programming
Ability to work in a team environment with multiple teams and challenging schedules

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Background in ISP, CV and NN is a big plus
Linux scripting and Matlab programming is a plus

Samsung Semiconductor Inc. (SSI), an equal opportunity employer, is a world leader in Memory, System LSI, and LCD technologies. Headquartered in San Jose, California, SSI is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd., the second largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world and the industry's volume and technology leader in DRAM, NAND Flash, SSDs, mobile DRAM and graphics memory. It is one of the largest providers of system logic, imaging and LED lighting solutions, as well as providing advanced process design and manufacturing for fabless companies. Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. also has a research and innovation center with numerous labs providing product design and research in: logic, memory, image sensors, displays and mobile technologies. In addition, the company supports Samsung Display Company, the largest producer of LCD and OLED displays.

*************************************************************************************************

Learn more about Samsung Semiconductor here.

A day in the life Samsung Video

Samsung Semiconductor Career Page

title: Senior System Software Engineer - Programmable Vision Accelerator
description:
We are now hiring a Senior System Software Engineer. This position will be part of a dynamic crew that develops and maintains systems software for complex, high performance heterogeneous computing systems powering disruptive products with an emphasis on autonomous driving, robotics and embedded solutions.

The Autonomous Driving revolution demands an ever stronger, faster and more efficient system software and CV/AI algorithms. It also demands rapidly innovative engineering alongside timely and safe execution. The NVIDIA's Programmable Vision Accelerator team plays a vital role in realizing that vision, building complex core technologies and industry leading platform solutions.

If you are an expert System Software Engineer, eager to take part in the transformative challenge presented by the upcoming Autonomous Driving revolution, if you are passionate about high-quality, real-time code - this job might be yours.

What you’ll be doing:
Working on Architecture and development work on NVIDIA System-on-Chip (SoC) hardware.
Focus on the Programmable Vision Accelerator (PVA) engine stack software architecture and design.
You would be involved with the early modeling and simulation required to produce our extraordinary products.
Drive implementation activities, participate in development and guide other specialists.
Need to gain proficiency in one of the technology areas and be able to support design of those components for upcoming chips.
Perform all work in accordance with safety and security standard (ISO 26262)
What we need to see:

We believe you are a dynamic self-starter and an excellent teammate to deliver winning solutions ahead of time. We would like to see your programming and debugging skills and in-depth understanding of processor architecture.
Proven programming background in C, data structures and coding conventions.
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer/Electronics engineering or related field.
6+ years of meaningful experience.
Deep understanding of embedded systems architecture: CPU, memory, buses and. interconnects, Operating Systems and device drivers
Strong knowledge and experience in designing and implementing Linux kernel drivers, OS internals and low-level debug.
Software design experience towards productization of complex, high performance hardware acceleration engines.
Excellent social skills.
Background in process development, such as JAMA/JIRA
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Experience in automotive and embedded.
Experience in SoC device driver development and related fields.
Familiarity with kernel level security concepts; this includes testing techniques and a familiarity with static code analysis, dynamic analysis, fuzzing, negative testing and other techniques.
QNX experience is a significant advantage.
Experience with designing and development software in accordance with functional safety and cyber security standards like ISO 26262.
Experience with architecture/design tools.
You will stand out demonstrating background in DSP or CUDA acceleration.
Background in productization and life-cycle of Computer Vision and Machine Learning projects.
NVIDIA is widely considered to be a global technology leader and one of most desirable workplace worldwide. We have some of the most forward-thinking and talented people in the world working for us and due to unprecedented growth, our elite engineering teams are rapidly growing fast. If you're creative, autonomous and enjoy having fun, then what are you waiting for, apply today!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Research Scientist - Computer Vision
description:
Contribute to exciting and high visibility projects that will push the state-of-the-art in image and video understanding, computer vision, machine learning, deep learning, and data mining and reasoning. This will involve generation and evaluation of novel ideas, presentation of these ideas to peers and customers and participation in engineering these ideas for real-world systems. The successful candidate will also have ample opportunities to lead projects based on their generated ideas. Our research group offers a dynamic, fun, and intellectually stimulating environment for cutting-edge research.
Areas of interest include but are not limited to: face detection/verification/recognition; face-based liveness detection and anti-spoofing; moving object detection and tracking; object classification/recognition/identification; 3D reconstruction; activity detection and classification; and scene classification and segmentation. Candidate should be conversant with the latest development in deep learning for visual recognition and video analytics, including the latest deep model compression and optimization techniques for edge inference and training. The ideal candidate possesses an impressive educational background in related fields with a strong publication record, and can demonstrate both the breadth and the depth of knowledge that is required to solve challenging problems in real-world scenarios.
Candidate Profile
MS in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Vision, Robotics, related field or equivalent experience; PhD preferred.
Solid research background and experience in computer vision, machine learning, and image/video analysis algorithms.
Current knowledge of research literature in Computer Vision with a history of publication in the field.
Excellent written and oral communication skills also required.
ObjectVideo Labs offers competitive pay and a generous benefits package including health and welfare benefits, 401(k) with employer match, paid holidays, paid time off, and paid maternity/paternity leave. We offer a casual work environment, gym subsidy, education assistance program, and in-suite bike racks and showers.
ObjectVideo Labs is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law.

title: Computer Vision Engineer
description:
Job Description
Computer Vision Engineer
Engineering - Pittsburgh, PA - Full Time

Company Overview

Since 2001, RE2 Robotics has remained committed to one primary mission: to develop innovative technologies that save lives and improve the quality of life.

Founded by Jorgen Pedersen, RE2 (Robotics Engineering Excellence) thrives on researching, designing and developing robotic technologies that enable users to safely and efficiently interact with their environments-- whether on the ground, in the air, or underwater. From concept to creation, we conduct cutting-edge research and develop robotic manipulator arm technology onsite in our collaborative facility, which is located in Pittsburgh?s historic Lawrenceville neighborhood.

Our team has expertise in all disciplines of robotics?from software development to electro-mechanical design. A Carnegie Mellon University spinoff, RE2 is committed to creating interoperable manipulation systems with human-like performance, intuitive robot interfaces and advanced autonomy software. We remain dedicated to solving our customers? most difficult robotics engineering problems, while forming long-lasting relationships that meet their current and future technical challenges.

Job Summary

RE2 Robotics has become a leading developer of mobile manipulation by working closely with universities, research institutes, and the federal government to create manipulation systems that are light-weight, rugged, and powerful. Through our research, we have developed manipulators that are highly dexterous and easily controlled. In our vision, the next horizon to mobile manipulation is the addition of greater autonomy of the system so that our systems can run with less supervision and in environments with highly limited bandwidth. The person filling the Computer Vision Engineer role will help us turn this vision into a reality.

Primarily, the Computer Vision Engineer will be responsible for developing autonomy and vision processing algorithms for use in a variety of products and projects. This position requires someone who can learn, develop, dream up and apply new techniques for novel problems focused on controlling robotic manipulators. Candidates must possess the following in order to apply.

+ M.S. or B.S. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or other related field

+ Minimum of 2 years of industry work experience in artificial intelligence, automation, and/or vision processing

+ Must be U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident

Responsibilities and Duties

+ Highlight the responsibilities. Make sure your list of responsibilities is brief but comprehensive. Also emphasize the duties that may be unique to your organization.

+ Outline the day-to-day activities of the position. This will help candidates understand the work environment and activities that they will be exposed to on a daily basis. This level of detail will help the candidate determine if the role and company are the right fit, helping you attract the best candidates for your position.

+ Specify how this position fits into your organization. Indicate to whom the role reports and the function of this position within your organization. This helps candidates see the bigger picture and understand how they can impact the business.

Qualifications and Skills

+ Lead the development of solutions in the areas of autonomous and vision-aided robotic systems.

+ Work closely with mechanical, electrical, and software engineering teams to develop systems from concept to production level.

+ Develop and execute autonomous and vision-aided robotic systems projects including guiding the technical approach and managing the development of the autonomous system.

Other Desired Skills and Experience

+ Excellent communication and teamwork skills

+ Knowledge of fundamentals and state of the art in robotics

+ Experience in applying machine learning and vision processing to real-world robotic problems

+ Knowledge of fundamentals in optimization, supervised and reinforcement learning

+ Strong research and innovation skills and ability to solve difficult vision and learning problems

+ Experience with ROS or other robotics platforms

+ Excellent prototyping skill and expert programming skills in multiple programming languages

+ Hands-on experience with multiple operating systems

+ Demonstrated ability to work on cross-functional teams

+ Flexibility and adaptability to work in a growing, dynamic team

Benefits and Perks

Location: Pittsburgh, PA
Hours: 40 hours/week
Compensation & Benefits: RE2 offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package including flexible schedules, stock options, 401k plan, training and professional development, paid time off, and medical/dental/vision/life and disability insurance for all regular full-time employees.

Please submit resumes directly to: jobs@resquared.com. - (RESUMES ACCEPTED IN PDF FORMAT ONLY)

RE2 provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Software Engineer (Computer Vision)
description:
Job Description
Job Title: Software Engineer (Computer Vision)

Duties:

Our Core Tech team explores, develops, and delivers new cutting-edge technologies that serve as the foundation of current and future products. From mixed reality and human interaction to natural inputs and beyond, Core Tech is focused on taking new technologies from early concept to the product level while iterating, prototyping, and realizing the human value and new experiences they open up.

We are seeking a talented Computer Vision Engineer to apply their skills to challenging and emerging problems in Hardware characterization. The Characterization team applies a range of software and computer vision techniques to characterize novel hardware to enable new experiences in VR. We' re looking for candidates who share a passion for applying software and computer vision techniques for the next generation VR headset.

Responsibilities
Develop novel computer vision algorithms and advanced systems with a focus on sensor and display characterization
Collect, process, and analyze 3D point cloud data for a variety of sensors across a variety of parameters and metrics
Develop and build software automation tools for computer vision and data analytics problems
Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability and stability of various systems
Minimum Qualifications
3+ years' experience developing computer vision software in Matlab and C++, including algorithm design and systems software development
Experience with 3D vision, 3D geometry and 3D point clouds
Knowledge of applied mathematics and numerical optimization
Prototyping or Sensors or Display Characterization experience
Preferred Qualifications
MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Robotics or related technical field
5+ years' experience developing real-time computer vision software in Matlab and C++, including algorithm design and systems software development
3+ years' experience with Sensor Characterization including depth sensors and cameras and/or Display quality characterization
Education:
MS in Computer Science, Computer Vision, Robotics or related technical field

Skills required for the role of Computer Vision Engineer A MS or PhD degree ndash Preferred subjects include Computer Vision, Deep learning and Data Science Experience applying Deep Learning methods to image data using at least one of the following techniques Artificial Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, Ability to apply statistical machine learning models with programming languages such as Python, C++ The following experience would be beneficial for the role of Computer Vision Engineer Part of the position would be in Deep Learning Engineering utilizing Deep Learning Frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Theano and Caffe. This particular client is looking for a Computer Vision Engineer that can show examples of contributions in publications or has registered patents in the field of Image Processing. title: Sr. Computer Vision Engineer
description:
Sr. Computer Vision Engineer
If you are a Sr. Computer Vision Engineer looking to join a startup that has created a vision based machine learning platform that is offering a tracking solution used to solve for segmentation within in the motion picture and television industry, please read on!

Based in Mountain View, CA near Whisman Station, we are a small (~20 person team) venture back, well funded startup having some fun with neural networks and computer vision! We are collaborating with major studios, industry veterans, and award-winning artists to re-invent the filmmaking process with self-improving AI at its core

We're immersed in cool vision work that has to perform at cinematic levels of quality. Subpixel segmentation, precise object tracking, human tracking and rigging, lighting and relighting, SLAM, leveraging geometric vision in 2D and 3D, on up to solving the inverse rendering problem.

Yes, you'll be working with filmmakers, musicians, game producers and, later, probably sports capture. Yes, we'll publish at major ML conferences, at Siggraph and relevant trade shows.
What You Will Be Doing
- Create and/or tune deep nets to solve problems in challenging computer vision domains
- Work with movie and TV customers to learn what needs to be solved
- Collect, synthesize and augment datasets in order to achieve nets with high performance
- Everything we do has a high quality offline together with a more basic real-time component. Be able to optimize high-performance nets to achieve real-time performance
- Leverage 2D and 3D geometric vision data and deliver product ready code
- Create algorithms that work with human-in-the-loop to accelerate human labor
What You Need for this Position
- Python and/or C++
- Knowledge of SW tools: Ubuntu, Git, Docker, Kubernetes, build bots, OpenCV and best if Pytorch.
- Expertise and experience in computer vision
- Bonus points for: Complete mastery of deep net theory and practice. You have created deepnets and seen them through to high performance and/or have published papers at the top conferences
So, if you are a Machine Learning Engineer (Computer Vision) with experience, please apply today!
-

title: Sr. Software Engineer (Computer Vision)
description:
Sr. Software Engineer (Computer Vision)
If you are a Sr. Software Engineer (Computer Vision) with experience, please read on!
Top Reasons to Work with Us
1. Based in Santa Clara, we are a leading developer of low-power, high-definition and Ultra HD video compression and image processing solutions.
2. Our company has been around for over a decade, so we offer a unique balance of stability and a small, tight-knit feel.
3. You will have the chance to work on exciting new development projects with a talented team.
What You Will Be Doing
- Develop deep understanding of our DSP architecture for efficient code development.
- Efficient use of hardware resources like CPU cycles and memory are core to scaling imaging and computer vision algorithms.

description:
Job Description
Computer Vision & Deep Learning Engineer contract. This is a 1 year contract position that could potentially be extended or offered a permanent position. Must be able to legally work in the US without sponsorship.

Primary job function is to perform R & D in computer vision, machine learning, and other areas. Tasks will include the development, simulation, evaluation, and implementation in software of computer vision and machine learning algorithms applied to a variety of applications. Additional job functions include solving customer problems, writing invention disclosures, publishing papers, briefing customers, and assisting in marketing company expertise.

Research experience in one or more of the following areas: computer vision, machine learning, deep learning, 2D and 3D object recognition. Application of computer vision and machine learning techniques to target detection, target recognition, image/video captioning, activity recognition, reinforcement learning and unsupervised learning.
Experience developing innovative solutions based upon the application of relevant research results from a wide variety of sources.

Computer Vision - especially 2D or 3D object detection and tracking, machine learning - especially deep learning techniques.
Good programming skills.
